Message.Title: Several important observations from yesterday's super bowl:
Message.Msg: 1. The score board tells the whole story, who cares about the detail; 2. Team effort is what counts, hard to say if it was the offense or defense of the Baltimore team but rather the entire team as is the case with running a company; 3. Mistakes were made by Baltimore but so what? And 4. Time is/was of critical importance but the firm determination of both teams to win was extraordinarily noteworthy.

Topic.Title: T-Superbowl

Message.Msg: You the MAN.

Message.Title: Getting back to AT@T
Message.Msg: Looks like T, along with the market, is recovering from the excessive exuberance of last Friday. T closed right on the upper Bollinger Band Friday and will very likely fall back for a couple days but the longer term trend is up. My target for May is $40 and some analysts think we could go as high as $44 this year.

Topic.Title: How sad what Florida has become

Message.Msg: Who wants to visit Florida, not safe to go out to dinner, not knowing if a nut with a gun wil come in and kill everyone. Or accost you then say right to not stand down. Couldn't pay me enough to visit FL. Answer this question, when did your ancestors move to America, and were there already people here then? Mine came around 1890-1905 from Europe. There were lots of people here already. Gee the Europeans came here about 300 years ago, and found the land already taken, but they took it for themselves without even asking. They killed many of the residents who were already here for thousands of years, who thought it was their home. They killed almost all the buffalo for just the hides, leaving the bodies to rot away. Going to Church all the while. Technically does it even belong to them now? Maybe you should look think a little deeper.

Topic.Title: How sad what Florida has become

Message.Msg: When again did your ancestors move to America? From where? Why did they move here, financial opportunities? There were already people here, why did they move here?

Topic.Title: When, where from, and why did your ancestors move to America?

Message.Msg: My great, great, great, grandfather came to Connecticut in 1740 to work as an indentured servant (slave) for seven years in exchange for his passage, board, and room. He only served 4 years because he married the masters daughter and was given a small farm as a wedding present.

Topic.Title: When, where from, and why did your ancestors move to America?

Message.Msg: A slave can be interpreted many ways, but the ones from Africa were bought and sold as property. They weren't indentured servants. My point is we all came here at different times, didn't we. There is no perceived ownership based on length of time here, like many, mainly on the right, seem to think they have.

Topic.Title: When, where from, and why did your ancestors move to America?

Message.Msg: My grandfather was a baker the other a barber both here about 1900. I put no more owership on America than a newer immigrant. We weren't first here in any case except for a native American. Both had their own stores and both worked for others. My father was apprenticed as a machinist and worked from age 14 to 67 dying at 69 in 1981 after 2 years of retirement. In the early days he worked 10-12 hr days 6 days a week for a few dollars per week, no sick leave pay no vacation pay, no retirement, nothing. The Unions changed all that for all of us. That's right, right wing nuts America is a nation of immigrants. I am tired of the liberal thinking right wing and their misunderstanding of what is America. Posing as patriots when the opposite is the truth.

Message.Msg: Now that's an interesting argument. If they had been good little capitalists, those Indians would have slaughtered us. I think you could ask a few of the Vietnam or Korea vets on this MB about Communists' familiarity with slaughter. Or maybe Stalin, Mao or Little Kim Jung Il himself. Russian peasants and factory workers did not slaughter the Russian aristocracy and middle class in 1917 and install a totalitarian Communist government because they were a bunch of goodie goodies who didn't understand human cruelty. Quite the opposite.

Topic.Title: Well Egypt agrees with me

Message.Msg: "ricky will challenge me to name the six" Why would I care if you can list the names of six people who work in the White House? I can do that too. What I challenge you to do is consider why you think the mouthpiece of a foreign dictator (which is what Rose El Youseff was) is credible but your own elected American government is not? Is it more credible than the US press, made up of Americans? Do you believe everything Rose El Youseff prints? Maybe you're the one under the influence of evil foreigners. I'm not joking about that. You follow supporters of a foreign dictator against your own elected American government, and your own American press corps. You're like those hippies that believed whatever the KGB told them . . .

Topic.Title: When, where from, and why did your ancestors move to America?

Message.Msg: It is a melting pot. Ever melted stuff? What happens if you add something new to the pot? Does the stuff in the pot stay exactly the same as it was before, no changes whatsoever? Or does it take on some of the characteristics and flavor of what was added? Must it become uniform throughout the mixture? Or can it swirl? Does everything always melt completely? Or can the mixture be a little chunky? And finally, who are you to decide which is "right"? You're just one little bit of a big chunky swirl. What you want is an America that is exactly the same as it was in your youth. Well, that America was very much different than America during every previous generation. The America of my youth has changed too.

Message.Title: AT&T Customer Service
Message.Msg: So far, have been on the line for over 110 minutes trying to get my family's cellphone service changed over to their mobile share data plan. This includes more than 30 minutes hold time. Have two separate accounts as AT&T formerly didn't allow more than 5 cellphones on a family plan. They allow 10 on the new plan. Have been a loyal AT&T customer for decades, always paying my bills on time, have excellent credit. Despite this, good ol' AT&T told me they couldn't combine my two accounts without a credit check. Now they have me back on hold because they have to transfer me to a third department to combine my home phone and internet bill with my cellphone bills, as they always were before. This really is a textbook example as to how inflict maximum pain, totally alienate, and #$%$ off your loyal customers. No wonder AT&T consistently ranks by far the worst of all cell carriers in customer service satisfaction surveys. I WOULD SWITCH MY SERVICE TO VERIZON TONIGHT, BUT MY KID'S CELLPHONE CONTRACTS EXPIRE ON DIFFERENT DATES, AND IT WOULD COST ME A FORTUNE. If you invest in this company, you are a fool. Still on hold. Thanks, AT&T. Addendum: Have now been on the phone with AT&T for over 2 hours. I have been speaking with someone in India who insists that my home phone number, which I have had for over 25 years, doesn't exist. I finally convinced this Indian national to call this phone number and speak with my wife to confirm that this number is indeed a valid number. This same person keeps asking about my AT&T U-verse service. I keep telling her that I don't have U-verse, I have dsl extreme 6.0 service. All I want to do is just combine my bill, as it was before. Addendum: The Indian woman couldn't figure it out. She's going to call me back. It is now 8:20 pm eastern time. I started on the phone with AT&T at a couple of minutes after six. I am a busy physician and had plans to go run this evening. Instead have been sitting on my butt on the phone. I'm so mad I could spit bullets. A simple switch that should have taken 5 minutes has taken up an entire evening. And there is still no resolution to the problem.

Topic.Title: AT&T Customer Service

Message.Msg: Now you know how patients feel. Drs are never on time for appointments.
